intro: Psychotria schippii, commonly known as the Schippi's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in the understory of tropical rainforests. The plant is also notable for containing psychoactive alkaloids, similar to those found in other members of the Psychotria genus.
